com.genband.mobile.api.utilities

Class Configuration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.genband.mobile.api.utilities.Configuration

  • public class Configuration
extends java.lang.Object
    ConfigurationService class represents all information about user's settings and private information.

    To access any configuration items (for example username attribute):
    String username = ConfigurationService.getInstance().getUsername();
    ConfigurationService.getInstance().setUsername("username value");

    Since:
    2.0.0

      • setWebSocketWithTokenAuthentication

        public void setWebSocketWithTokenAuthentication(boolean tokenAuthentication)
        Sets webSocketAuthentication Mode If true, it uses token for webSocketConnection. If false, it uses regular authentication for webSocketConnection. Default value is false.
        Parameters:
        tokenAuthentication - boolean value for webSocketAuthentication mode
        Since:
        5.7.0

      • getWebSocketWithTokenAuthentication

        public boolean getWebSocketWithTokenAuthentication()
        Gets webSocketConnection mode If true, it uses token for webSocketConnection. If false, it uses regular authentication for webSocketConnection. Default value is false.
        Returns:
        webSocketWithTokenAuthentication mode value
        Since:
        5.7.0

      • setServerCertificate

        public void setServerCertificate(java.security.cert.Certificate serverCertificate)
        Sets the server certificate for secure HTTPS. If the server certificate is already uploaded to the device's platform and detected as a trusted certificate, this step can be omitted If a custom server certificate is used, the method must be used X509 is supported as certificate
        Parameters:
        serverCertificate - server certificate to be used in HTTPS connection
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • setDefaultCameraMode

        public void setDefaultCameraMode(int cameraMode)
        Sets default camera mode for every call. Default mode is front camera.

        0 CameraInfo.CAMERA_FACING_BACK; 1 CameraInfo.CAMERA_FACING_FRONT;

        Parameters:
        cameraMode -

      • setDtmfToneDuration

        public void setDtmfToneDuration(int dtmfToneDuration)
        Sets duration value of DTMF tones im ms
        Parameters:
        dtmfToneDuration - duration value for DTMF tone in ms. Default value is 600 and can be between 40 and 6000
        Since:
        3.0.1

      • getICECollectionTimeout

        public int getICECollectionTimeout()
        Returns timeout value of ICE Collection
        Returns:
        timeout value for ICE Collection in second.
        Since:
        3.1.3

      • setICECollectionTimeout

        public void setICECollectionTimeout(int ICECollectionTimeout)
        Sets timeout value of ICE Collection
        Parameters:
        ICECollectionTimeout - timeout value for ICE Collection in second.

        Default value is 10 seconds and it means that it waits 10 seconds for ice gathering. If set to 0, it means that SDK will wait until ice gathering completion.

        Since:
        3.1.3

      • getDtmfToneDuration

        public int getDtmfToneDuration()
        Returns duration value of DTMF tones im ms
        Returns:
        duration value for DTMF tone in ms.
        Since:
        3.0.1

      • setIceOption

        public void setIceOption(ICEOptions iceOption)
        Sets ice option. Using this option applications can choose to use TrickleIce or VanillaIce ice options. Default is VanillaIce.
        Parameters:
        iceOption - ICEOptions ICE_VANILLA or ICE_TRICKLE
        Since:
        4.1.0

      • setAudioOpusCodecConfigurations

        public void setAudioOpusCodecConfigurations(AudioCodecConfiguration audioCodecConfiguration)
        Sets the Audio Codec configurations. If parameter is null WebRTC defaults will be use. Warning: This is advance usage if you don't have expertise on Opus audio codec don't use it.
        Parameters:
        audioCodecConfiguration - AudioCodecConfiguration object which will contains all Opus audio codec configurations.
        Since:
        4.2.4

      • getAudioOpusCodecConfigurations

        public AudioCodecConfiguration getAudioOpusCodecConfigurations()
        Gets the Opus audio codec configurations.
        Returns:
        AudioCodecConfiguration

        Returns:
        int
        Since:
        4.3.0

      • setWebSocketIdleTimeout

        public void setWebSocketIdleTimeout(int timeoutInSeconds)
        Sets idle timeout for websocket. Value must be in seconds If websocket is idle more than this value, websocket will reconnect again.
        Parameters:
        timeoutInSeconds -
        Since:
        4.3.0

      • setForceDisableMediaOnHold

        public void setForceDisableMediaOnHold(boolean value)
        Forces to disable media transfer when media on hold is active. It helps to fix some MOH issues on PSTN calls
        Since:
        4.5.5

      • setReceiveVideoBandwidth

        public void setReceiveVideoBandwidth(CallReceiveBandwidthLimit callReceiveBandwidthLimit)
        Sets the bandwidth limit for all outgoing calls to be created and incoming calls to be received. This bandwidth limit will take effect on received audio/video stream by defining the max bitrate received for local peer
        Parameters:
        callReceiveBandwidthLimit - set Bandwidth for receiver side of the audio and video call
        Since:
        4.6.1

      • getReceiveBandwidthSetting

        public CallReceiveBandwidthLimit getReceiveBandwidthSetting()

      • isHttpPersistentConnectionEnabled

        public boolean isHttpPersistentConnectionEnabled()
        Indicates whether httpPersistentConnection is enabled or not
        Returns:
        true if enabled, false otherwise
        Since:
        5.4.0

      • setHttpPersistentConnection

        public void setHttpPersistentConnection(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Sets the indicator which shows whether httpPersistentConnection is enabled or not
        Parameters:
        value - true for enabled, Connection: keep-alive HTTP Header; false for disabled, Connection: close HTTP Header
        Since:
        5.4.0

        Returns:

        Since:
        5.15.0

      • setRingingFeedbackOption

        public void setRingingFeedbackOption(RingingFeedbackOptions ringingFeedbackOption)
        NONE --> There will be no ringing feedback. SERVER --> Server based ringing feedback. CLIENT --> Client based ringing feedback. Default value is CLIENT.
        Parameters:
        ringingFeedbackOption - NONE, SERVER or CLIENT.
        Since:
        5.15.0
